Class Solutions

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Button[][] copyGrid(Button[][] Grid)
      Creates a new grid (2D Array) of Buttons and copy's the information of each button from the Grid being sent in.
      java.lang.String getSnapshot(Button[][] Grid)
      Get a string representation of the grid of buttons being called in.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSolution()
      Creates the map all the possible unique moves made and Performs the breadth first search in order to get to the solution of a given grid in the shortest amount of moves.
      void printFromString(java.lang.String SnapShot)
      Method used for debugging.
      void printGrid(Button[][] Grid)
      Method used for debugging.
      void printMap(java.util.HashMap HMap)
      Method used for debugging.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> printSolutionBackwards(Node N)
      Prints out the snapshots as grids starting from the snapshot of the goal piece in the desired position in the grid.
      void setAllMovesLists(Button[][] Grid, java.util.HashMap BMap)
      Sets all possible moves for each piece in the grid.
      void setChildrenList(Node parentNode, Button[][] Grid)
      Runs through each piece of the grid, creates new grids based on each possible move that can be made from each piece, creates a snapshot of the grid, checks hash map that will be storing the Snapshots of there is one already made if not then it stores the snapshot along with the grid to the hashmap "SnapShotMap" to prevent creating loops when running through the breadth first search.
      java.util.HashMap setGridHashMap(java.lang.String CurrentSnapshot, Button[][] Grid)
      Sets a hash map for a grid using the grid's snapshot to set each piece's Tag in the grid as the key that maps to the given button.

    • Method Detail

      • getSolution

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSolution()
        Creates the map all the possible unique moves made and Performs the breadth first search in order to get to the solution of a given grid in the shortest amount of moves.
        Returns:
        Arraylist of Strings that each represent a move made to get to the solution.

      • printSolutionBackwards

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> printSolutionBackwards(Node N)
        Prints out the snapshots as grids starting from the snapshot of the goal piece in the desired position in the grid.
        Parameters:
        N -

      • printFromString

        public void printFromString(java.lang.String SnapShot)
        Method used for debugging. Print's out the snapshot called in as a Grid
        Parameters:
        SnapShot -

      • setChildrenList

        public void setChildrenList(Node parentNode,
                   Button[][] Grid)
        Runs through each piece of the grid, creates new grids based on each possible move that can be made from each piece, creates a snapshot of the grid, checks hash map that will be storing the Snapshots of there is one already made if not then it stores the snapshot along with the grid to the hashmap "SnapShotMap" to prevent creating loops when running through the breadth first search.
        Parameters:
        parentNode -
        Grid -

      • copyGrid

        public Button[][] copyGrid(Button[][] Grid)
        Creates a new grid (2D Array) of Buttons and copy's the information of each button from the Grid being sent in. Used for the setChildrenList method.
        Parameters:
        Grid -
        Returns:
        new Grid with the copied info for each button.

      • getSnapshot

        public java.lang.String getSnapshot(Button[][] Grid)
        Get a string representation of the grid of buttons being called in. Each character in the string will a button in the grid. B's will represent "blank" buttons.
        Parameters:
        Grid -
        Returns:
        a String that will represent the grid called in.

      • setAllMovesLists

        public void setAllMovesLists(Button[][] Grid,
                    java.util.HashMap BMap)
        Sets all possible moves for each piece in the grid.
        Parameters:
        Grid -
        BMap -

      • setGridHashMap

        public java.util.HashMap setGridHashMap(java.lang.String CurrentSnapshot,
                               Button[][] Grid)
        Sets a hash map for a grid using the grid's snapshot to set each piece's Tag in the grid as the key that maps to the given button.
        Parameters:
        CurrentSnapshot -
        Grid -
        Returns:
        the hash map for the pieces in the grid.

      • printMap

        public void printMap(java.util.HashMap HMap)
        Method used for debugging. Prints out the hashmap that contains the info for each button in a given grid.
